title: snapshot generation stuck in a loop
body:
#### System information

Version: 1.10.6-stable
Architecture: amd64
Go Version: go1.16.6

#### Expected behaviour
Snapshot sync generates the snapshot properly

#### Actual behaviour
The generation gets stuck in a loop of aborting state snapshot generation and resuming

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
Not sure, after london, my node fell behind and is stuck here. On previous versions of geth I ran --snapshot=false as a cli arg to disable the snapshot generation, but in the latest version it seems that geth is ignoring this flag

#### Backtrace

````
Aug 06 05:19:04 ip-172-31-42-206 geth[216119]: INFO [08-06|05:19:04.074] Aborting state snapshot generation       root=059d7b..9644cb at=899483..9872e5 accounts=76,177,258 slots=534,851,392 storage=45.83GiB elapsed=5m11.477s  eta=1838h34m4.852s
Aug 06 05:19:04 ip-172-31-42-206 geth[216119]: INFO [08-06|05:19:04.084] Resuming state snapshot generation       root=8a9639..3d7787 at=899483..9872e5 accounts=76,177,258 slots=534,851,392 storage=45.83GiB elapsed=5m11.487s  eta=1838h37m37.352s
Aug 06 05:19:04 ip-172-31-42-206 geth[216119]: INFO [08-06|05:19:04.621] Aborting state snapshot generation       root=8a9639..3d7787 at=899483..9872e5 accounts=76,177,258 slots=534,851,392 storage=45.83GiB elapsed=5m12.024s  eta=1841h47m48.49s
Aug 06 05:19:04 ip-172-31-42-206 geth[216119]: INFO [08-06|05:19:04.644] Resuming state snapshot generation       root=f54746..e150d1 at=899483..9872e5 accounts=76,177,258 slots=534,851,392 storage=45.83GiB elapsed=5m12.047s  eta=1841h55m57.239s
Aug 06 05:19:05 ip-172-31-42-206 geth[216119]: INFO [08-06|05:19:05.158] Aborting state snapshot generation       root=f54746..e150d1 at=899483..9872e5 accounts=76,177,258 slots=534,851,392 storage=45.83GiB elapsed=5m12.561s  eta=1844h57m59.636s
Aug 06 05:19:05 ip-172-31-42-206 geth[216119]: INFO [08-06|05:19:05.169] Resuming state snapshot generation       root=b373fc..dbccf0 at=899483..9872e5 accounts=76,177,258 slots=534,851,392 storage=45.83GiB elapsed=5m12.572s  eta=1845h1m53.383s
Aug 06 05:19:05 ip-172-31-42-206 geth[216119]: INFO [08-06|05:19:05.674] Aborting state snapshot generation       root=b373fc..dbccf0 at=899483..9872e5 accounts=76,177,258 slots=534,851,392 storage=45.83GiB elapsed=5m13.077s  eta=1848h0m44.533s
Aug 06 05:19:05 ip-172-31-42-206 geth[216119]: INFO [08-06|05:19:05.679] Resuming state snapshot generation       root=4dc8a0..9f1c58 at=899483..9872e5 accounts=76,177,258 slots=534,851,392 storage=45.83GiB elapsed=5m13.082s  eta=1848h2m30.779s

````
What change does it make if `--snapshot=false`

> 
> 
> What change does it make if `--snapshot=false`

On previous versions (I was on 1.10.3) using --snapshot=false would disable the generation of the snapshot. In the newer version the option still shows in geth help but it gets ignored.

I believe it's not stuck in a loop, rather snapshot generation can only progress when blocks are not importing. So if you are not caught up with the network, snapshot generation keeps getting interrupted by every single block that's being imported. It would probably make sense to do longer interrupts if we're importing an entire batch of blocks.

Aren't you seeing block import messages every now and again? If yes, can you paste them here just to confirm my hunch?

> 
> 
> I believe it's not stuck in a loop, rather snapshot generation can only progress when blocks are not importing. So if you are not caught up with the network, snapshot generation keeps getting interrupted by every single block that's being imported. It would probably make sense to do longer interrupts if we're importing an entire batch of blocks.
> 
> Aren't you seeing block import messages every now and again? If yes, can you paste them here just to confirm my hunch?

Yes, I see them every few seconds, but those are the new blocks being added to the head, because when I checked eth_syncing it returned false

@karalabe I just upgraded our rinkeby node and am observing the same problem. I upgraded it to current `master` (067084feda, after v1.10.8) and restarted. The logs show an endless stream of
```

Aug 31 16:53:26 ethtestnet geth[1794]: INFO [08-31|16:53:26.508] Resuming state snapshot generation       root=ed4685..448987 at=004b36.
.1d4529 accounts=4302 slots=77453 storage=6.38MiB elapsed=1m35.187s  eta=48h31m44.193s

.1d4529 accounts=4302 slots=77453 storage=6.38MiB elapsed=1m35.361s  eta=48h37m3.545s
Aug 31 16:53:26 ethtestnet geth[1794]: INFO [08-31|16:53:26.864] Aborting state snapshot generation       root=7a3b3e..64201a at=004b36.
.1d4529 accounts=4302 slots=77453 storage=6.38MiB elapsed=1m35.543s  eta=48h42m37.581s
Aug 31 16:53:26 ethtestnet geth[1794]: INFO [08-31|16:53:26.864] Resuming state snapshot generation       root=eba50d..23a25a at=004b36.
.1d4529 accounts=4302 slots=77453 storage=6.38MiB elapsed=1m35.543s  eta=48h42m37.581s
Aug 31 16:53:27 ethtestnet geth[1794]: INFO [08-31|16:53:27.018] Aborting state snapshot generation       root=eba50d..23a25a at=004b36.
.1d4529 accounts=4302 slots=77453 storage=6.38MiB elapsed=1m35.697s  eta=48h47m20.226s
Aug 31 16:53:27 ethtestnet geth[1794]: INFO [08-31|16:53:27.018] Resuming state snapshot generation       root=2641dd..5d0304 at=004b36.
.1d4529 accounts=4302 slots=77453 storage=6.38MiB elapsed=1m35.697s  eta=48h47m20.226s
```
so alternating between aborting and resuming every ~150ms.

The node runs with
```
geth --rinkeby --maxpeers 256 --cache 4096
```
Adding `--snapshot=false` doesn't make a difference, it is enabled by snap.
